MarsX.LocationDef.label: Jezero crater
MarsX.LocationDef.description: Jezero crater has been selected as a possible location for the first colony on Mars, there should be an ample supply of water from the subterranean ice scarps located in the crater making this an ideal location for establishing our first colony

MarsX.LocationDef.label: Gale Crater
MarsX.LocationDef.description:
Gale crater is a scientifically fascinating site on Mars with abundant orbital and ground data for assessing a human mission. The crater harbored ancient habitable environments and abundant liquid water in the past.
ISRU resources for H2O, Fe, Al, and Si have been identified and quantified. A human mission to this location comes with the assurance to what we’d find on arrival and the strong potential for future discoveries.

MarsX.LocationDef.label: Mawrth Vallis
MarsX.LocationDef.description:
Mawrth Vallis (Mawrth means "Mars" in Welsh) is a valley on Mars, located in the Oxia Palus.
Situated between the southern highlands and northern lowlands, the valley is a channel formed by massive flooding which occurred in Mars’ ancient past.
It is an ancient water outflow channel with light-colored clay-rich rocks.

MarsX.LocationDef.label: Eberswalde delta
MarsX.LocationDef.description:
Eberswalde is a partially buried impact crater in Margaritifer Terra, Mars. Eberswalde Crater lies just to the north of Holden Crater, a large crater that may have been a lake.
The crater contains inverted relief, an exhumed delta formed by the flow of a liquid, most likely water. The series of valleys leading into the delta "drain" an area of approximately 4000 km²

MarsX.LocationDef.label: McLaughlin Crater
MarsX.LocationDef.description:
An ancient Martian impact crater located just south of the dichotomy boundary.
It contains volatile-rich rocks that will not only yield interesting results regarding ancient atmospheric chemistry, but will also be high quality, accessible targets for ISRU, and the site within the crater provides a flat, low-risk and low-elevation landing zone

MarsX.LocationDef.label: Noctis Labyrinthus
MarsX.LocationDef.description:
Noctis Labyrinthus is a region of Mars between Valles Marineris and the Tharsis upland. The region is notable for its maze-like system of deep, steep-walled valleys.
This zone meets all key Science and Resources requirements. The site is of significant interest as it is located strategically at the crossroads between Tharsis and Valles Marineris, which are key for long-term exploration.
